title: `no header found with number 15570025`
body:
**System information**
erigon version 2022.10.1-dev-e935e20f

OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS

**Expected behaviour**
Erigon syncs....

**Actual behaviour**
Hi, I started sync from scratch on Saturday because of the other issues I could not find resolution to.
I updated to latest `devel` branch today before finishing sync.

Now I'm seeing this:

```
Oct 06 02:13:48 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:48.541] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:49 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:49.043] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:49 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:49.543] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:50 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:50.045] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:50 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:50.546] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:51 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:51.047] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:51 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:51.548] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:52 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:52.049] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:52 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:52.551] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:53 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:53.052] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:53 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:53.552] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:54 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:54.054] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:54 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:54.554] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
Oct 06 02:13:55 nuc erigon[66923]: [EROR] [10-06|02:13:55.055] Staged Sync                              err="[9/16 IntermediateHashes] no header found with number 15570025"
```

My node has been out of commission since the merge, would really appreciate any support.

I have the same behavior on a different block. It initializes properly up until the PoS block download stage, and then it's a wall of "no header found". Verbose log [here](https://gist.github.com/ac130kz/9febee0526e40590a83aab1ea1a2700f).

```

I am having the same issue. My node, on Ubuntu 20.04.5 x86_64, has been syncing since last week, using Erigon version 2022.09.03. I ran into the "no header found" errors, upgraded Erigon to 2022.10.01, which didn't help. Yesterday, I switched to `erigon version 2.27.0-dev-ff2e763a`, still no effect. This is what my log looks like:

I am also seeing this on `erigon version 2.27.0-stable-5b7efb04`
Same issue. What I have to do?

The following workaround worked for me:

First, stop `erigon` and look at the status of the stages:
```
> integration print_stages --chain mainnet --datadir <datadir path>
INFO[10-08|10:42:42.663] [Snapshots] Blocks Stat                  blocks=15000k indices=15000k alloc=2.3GB sys=2.4GB
Note: prune_at doesn't mean 'all data before were deleted' - it just mean stage.Prune function were run to this block. Because 1 stage may prune multiple data types to different prune distance.

                                 stage_at        prune_at
Snapshots                        14999999        0
Headers                          14999999        0
BlockHashes                      14999999        0
Bodies                           14999999        0
Senders                          14999999        0
Execution                        15035619        14999999
Translation                      0               0
HashState                        15035619        0
IntermediateHashes               14999999        14999999
AccountHistoryIndex              14999999        14999999
StorageHistoryIndex              14999999        14999999
LogIndex                         14999999        14999999
CallTraces                       14999999        14999999
TxLookup                         0               0
Finish                           14999999        0
--
prune distance: --prune.h.older=90000 --prune.t.older=90000 --prune.c.older=90000 --prune.r.before=11052984

sequence: EthTx=1643669426, NonCanonicalTx=0

no headers in db
no bodies in db

--
snapsthos: blocks=14999999, segments=14999999, indices=14999999
```

Notice that `HashState` and `Execution` are ahead of the others by 35620 blocks. We will unwind them:
```
> integration stage_hash_state --chain mainnet --datadir <datadir path> --unwind=35620
INFO[10-08|10:43:28.249] [Snapshots] Blocks Stat                  blocks=15000k indices=15000k alloc=2.1GB sys=2.2GB
INFO[10-08|10:43:28.260] Stage                                    name=HashState progress=15035619
INFO[10-08|10:43:28.260] [8/16 HashState] Unwinding started       from=15035619 to=14999999 storage=false codes=true
INFO[10-08|10:43:59.375] [8/16 HashState] Unwinding started       from=15035619 to=14999999 storage=false codes=false
INFO[10-08|10:44:56.367] [8/16 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading       into=HashedAccount progress=83 alloc=3.4GB sys=4.4GB
INFO[10-08|10:45:10.742] [8/16 HashState] Unwinding started       from=15035619 to=14999999 storage=true codes=false
INFO[10-08|10:45:24.788] [8/16 HashState] Flushed buffer file     name=<datadir path>/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-3275482862 alloc=3.6GB sys=4.4GB
INFO[10-08|10:45:39.179] [8/16 HashState] Flushed buffer file     name=<datadir path>/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-4027182542 alloc=3.4GB sys=4.5GB
INFO[10-08|10:45:40.744] [8/16 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    from=StorageChangeSet progress=0 alloc=3.6GB sys=4.5GB
INFO[10-08|10:45:54.979] [8/16 HashState] Flushed buffer file     name=<datadir path>/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-3186020270 alloc=2.7GB sys=4.5GB
INFO[10-08|10:46:07.671] [8/16 HashState] Flushed buffer file     name=<datadir path>/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-1083827324 alloc=4.5GB sys=5.2GB
INFO[10-08|10:46:12.204] [8/16 HashState] Flushed buffer file     name=<datadir path>/etl-temp/erigon-sortable-buf-2694207612 alloc=2.3GB sys=5.2GB
INFO[10-08|10:46:42.215] [8/16 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading       into=HashedStorage progress=69 alloc=2.9GB sys=5.2GB
INFO[10-08|10:47:12.217] [8/16 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading       into=HashedStorage progress=86 alloc=3.5GB sys=5.2GB
INFO[10-08|10:47:28.514] [8/16 HashState] etl: temp files removed total size=590.3MB
```
```
> integration stage_exec --chain mainnet --datadir <datadir path> --unwind=35620

(It may also be useful to restart the CL client when restarting `erigon`.)
